description: This survey of modern Japan from 1800 to the present examines the political
transformation of the Meiji Restoration, the industrial revolution and social and
cultural change, the rise and fall of party government, militarism and Japanese
expansionism in World War II, the American occupation, and postwar social, political,
economic, and cultural developments. Offered alternate years. Also counts toward Asian studies and
Japanese majors and Asian studies and management studies
